A resident assistant stood in blinding smoke and extinguished a kitchen fire in McKee Hall late Monday afternoon PERIOD

C.C PERIOD Cook the resident assistant on duty in the basement rushed to the thirdfloor kitchen after two students ran downstairs and told her the kitchen was on fire PERIOD

 Cook said PERIOD 

Cook immediately found a fire extinguisher and put out the fire PERIOD

 Cook said PERIOD 

Cook said she stayed around several more minutes to make sure the fire had been completely put out PERIOD

After the fire had been extinguished Cook said she was still having problems breathing from all the smoke she inhaled PERIOD She also said campus police arrived at McKee very quickly after the start of the fire PERIOD

David Gaudin captain of Starkville Fire Department said the fire started when student Tarnicia Durham left a pizza in the oven that already contained a halfcooked chicken pot pie PERIOD The pot pie was left unattended too long and caught on fire PERIOD

Gaudin said the fire was contained inside the oven but there was an extreme amount of smoke PERIOD The entire building was evacuated and there was no damage other than smoke damage PERIOD

 Gaudin said PERIOD

Ann Bailey director of housing and residents said kitchen fires dont happen frequently but still occur randomly in residence halls PERIOD Bailey mentioned the possibility of having a program for cooking safety to prevent future kitchen fires PERIOD
